DataElement.preferredName: Protocol North Central Cancer Treatment Group Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the Cooperative Group-specific alphanumeric identifier assigned to an NCI-sponsored protocol by the North Central Clinical Trials Group (NCCTG).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol North Central Cancer Treatment Group Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the protocol's NCCTG ID.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.

Property.preferredName: North Central Cancer Treatment Group Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: The North Central Cancer Treatment Group (NCCTG) is a national clinical research group sponsored by the NCI. The research base for NCCTG is located at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn. NCCTG consists of a network of more than 1,000 cancer specialists at community clinics, hospitals and medical centers in 25 states in US, two Canadian provinces and Mexico. NCCTG specializes in researching methods of treating and preventing cancer, and in researching methods to alleviate the side effects of cancer and cancer treatments.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A national clinical research group sponsored by the NCI. The research base for NCCTG is located at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn. NCCTG consists of a network of more than 1,000 cancer specialists at community clinics, hospitals and medical centers in 25 states in US, two Canadian provinces and Mexico. NCCTG specializes in researching methods of treating and preventing cancer, and in researching methods to alleviate the side effects of cancer and cancer treatments.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric or alphanumeric identification assigned to the study by the National Cancer Institute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
